metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32292 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In ConnMan through 1.41, remote attackers able to send HTTP requests to thegweb component are able to exploit a heap-based buffer overflow inreceived_data to execute code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32292` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

connman - 1.21-1.2+deb8u1ubuntu0.1~esm1
connman-vpn - 1.21-1.2+deb8u1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: connman package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.21-1.2+deb8u1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
